Question: Narrowest pa of uterine tube is: March 2013
Choices:
  A: Infundibulum
  B: Ampulla
  C: Isthmus
  D: Interstitial
Reflection:

Use your self-reflection (below) to help you answer this question.
Any information that you are not allowed to see will be marked [REDACTED].
No reflection information provided.

Thought:
The uterine tube, also known as the fallopian tube, has four parts: the infundibulum, ampulla, isthmus, and interstitial part. The infundibulum is the funnel-shaped opening of the tube that captures the egg released from the ovary. The ampulla is the widest and longest part of the tube, where fertilization usually occurs. The isthmus is the narrowest part of the tube, connecting the ampulla to the uterus. The interstitial part is the portion of the tube that passes through the muscular wall of the uterus.
Action: Answer("C")
